title: Teemo's Blind
body:
Nidalee's Couger Form "Q" does not get blinded anymore, (it used to from s5, I do not know when it got changed)

Ekko's -E-AUTO does not get blinded. (same thing as nida q, from s5, it was able to be blinded)

What is Voliber's Q and Hecarim's E autos? Aren't they "empowered" or "modified" auto attack? which should be able to be blinded?

for example, Renekton or Twisted Fate's stuns are able to be blinded. yet voli and heca's skills are not.

Lastly, Compare to Pantheon's passive"block" can block red card from Twisted Fate and Kayle's "E" auto, Teemo's Blind do not blind those magic part of it.

I would like to have these bugs fixed or explanation if possible.

oh right, Fervor of battle bugs is getting fixed in 6.14 patch right?
(currently, allot of champions' skills do not give fervor of battle stacks since 6.12 including)

replies.body:
Can't talk about the bugs, but in relation to Volibear's Q:

The way I understood it is.. blind reduces basic attack damage by 100% on-hit (including most on-hit effects), but something like Shen's W blocks basic attacks completely (hence Volibear's Q is blocked by Shen but not Teemo).

Upvoted, hope you get a quick answer. :P

>  blind reduces basic attack damage by 100% on hit,

Still doesn't add up, since that means on-hit effects would apply through blind. Not 100%, but pretty sure they don't.
Yep, on-hit effects have their damage mitigated as well

Blind prevents all sorts of effects, not just regular auto attacks.

It makes Sona waste a power chord buff without dealing damage or providing bonus effects.

I hope they look into Xin to as for the same reason He still does damage when I blind him. Only his ulti should do so & the same goes Irelia. Why cant Teemo blind her stun? I swear he was able to before...

Irelia stun is a targeted ability so no - it couldn't be blinded.

As for other cases, keep in mind the following:

- Blind applies only for attacks that hasn't been started yet. So, if you blind someone who is already starting his attack animation (or the projectile is in flight for example) - you will still get hit (it also means that if enemy starts attacking while blinded and the blind runs out - the attack will still miss).
- Buffered attacks also seem to go through blind. By that I mean - if you use ability while getting blinded the AA following that ability will hit. I am not 100% sure of that, as I didn't get to test it extensively (but that's the general feeling I get, especially from Yasuo Q->AA and Vayne Q->AA). I believe this is a bug, and it's also possible with other CC (at least it was a bug quite some time ago, I don't know if it has been fixed already - but it seems to be working with blind).

I'd really just have them apply blind instantly (that is, even for attacks already in motion), so it doesn't feel so bad to use.

No, that makes perfect sense that you can blind Twisted Fate's yellow cards but not Irelia stun. One is an ability that empowers a basic attack, the other's a straight-out ability that has nothing to do with an attack.

The range is completely irrelevant. Otherwise, Teemo would be useless against marksmen despite typically being called a counter to them, because his blind wouldn't affect them - after all, they're all ranged, and a lot of them have pretty high range, too.

It might help you to treat League as, y'know, a game. Hell, I'd compare it more with a TCG like Magic: The Gathering than something like a Mario game, because like MtG you have various rules created by various abilities that all interact in ways that may not make realistic sense in the slightest. On the flipside, you can generally know what to expect in a Mario game and it won't really change that on you, unless a very gimmicky gimmick is involved; it's only when you encounter glitches that the fact that the game is ultimately based on very specific rules that make not actually make sense comes to light.

To be honest, this is a good post, and it needs to be clarified by Riot, hopefully. The last few seasons, Riot has taken the approach of making the game more understandable by all, and more "clear" what is happening in the game. Things like this, that are described on the Wiki as "blocks some, but not all" and then later "most effects go through blind" are very unclear, and a clarification would be a great addition to the game, as well as bug fixes (if those results are unintended).

Perhaps a "why" would be helpful for more transparency as well. For example, WHY is renekton's W stun blocked by Teemo's blind, but Udyr's E stun is not? They're essentially the same things (a hit that applies a stun), but the result/outcome is 100% different.

If this is a bug, it'd be great to have it fixed. Honestly, something like this would make a mostly non-meta champion, like Teemo, feel the quality of life strengths that might allow him to be a bit more competitive, and it could increase champion diversity indirectly as well.
